title.narrative: OUTPUT 2: FACILITIES Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: Facilities Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH): Package of sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) facilities and hygiene promotion in institutions modelled and scaled up nationally to contribute to CF environments and improved MCH. Generation of evidence to support national scale up and influence national education and health policies., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Salaries and Related costs

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF GENDER AND SOCIAL SER GARISSA

sector.narrative: Risk management and resilience/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Facilities WASH: Package of sustainable WASH facilities and hygiene promotion in institutions modelled and scaled up nationally tocontribute to CF environments and improved MCH. Generation of evidence to support national scale up and influence nationaleducation and health policies.

description.narrative: WASH services were improved in 125 schools benefiting 54,915 children. Menstrual hygiene management was promoted in 29 schools. Leveraging resources for WASH in schools was achieved in 3 counties for a total of USD 330,000. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2018

title.narrative: Number of schools with Menstrual Hygiene Management implemented in schools programmes as a result of UNICEF direct support and/or leveraged through national programmes.
Number of pupils with access to basic WASH service in schools in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Schools at which WASH facilities have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
